titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Graduate School of Political Management political advertisement videocassette collection, 1970-2005 MS2241.UA
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Graduate School of Political Management political advertisement videocassette collection
did.abstract: This collection contains video cassettes used for educational purposes in GSPM classes. The videos contain political advertisements; local and national news reports and other broadcast programming related to politics; educational programs including forums, panels, lectures, and series; speeches, debates and political conventions; and political movies and documentaries. They range in date from 1970-2005 with some videos undated. The bulk of the collection materials cover 1988-1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Graduate School of Political Management political advertisement videocassette collection, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Graduate School of Political Management, 2007(Accession 2007.082)

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Graduate School of Political Management, GSPM, part of The George Washington University in Washington, D.C., is the nation's first school for professional politics. Its mission is to "improve politics by educating its students and professionals in the tools, principles and values of participatory democracy, preparing them for careers and ethical and effective advocates and leaders at the international, national and local levels."

In 1986, Neil Fabricant, a lawyer from New York City and former Legislative Director of the New York Civil Liberties Union, proposed the creation of a dedicated school to nurture the development of the profession of politics. The Graduate School of Political Management was founded in September 1987 with 24 students. It was chartered by the New York State Board of Regents and operated as an independent graduate school on the Manhattan campus of Baruch College. Christopher Arterton was named Dean of the School. In September 1991, the School opened a degree program on The George Washington University campus. GSPM was acquired by the University in July 1995 and made a component of its Columbian School of Arts and Sciences.

The School offers Master of Professional Studies degrees in Political Management, Legislative Affairs and Strategic Public Relations, and graduate certificates in PACs and Political Management and Public Relations.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains video cassettes used for educational purposes in GSPM classes. The videos contain political advertisements; local and national news reports and other broadcast programming related to politics; educational programs including forums, panels, lectures, and series; speeches, debates and political conventions; and political movies and documentaries. They range in date from 1970-2005 with some videos undated. The bulk of the collection materials cover 1988-1998.

This collection is a valuable historical record of television coverage of past elections, including candidate advertisements; news coverage; broadcasted debates, speeches and conventions; and interest group advertisements. This collection also provides a wealth of information on the process of creating effective political advertisements; the political process, including the political profession; and social issues relevant to elections or the political process.
This collection was donated by the Graduate School of Political Management in 2007.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: Political advertisements; Broadcast programming; Political education; Speeches and debates; and Movies and documentaries.

controlaccess.subject: Advertising
Politics and government
controlaccess.corpname: George Washington University. Graduate School of Political Management

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The videos of this series include political advertisements. They range in date from 1970-2002 with some undated videos. The bulk of the series covers 1990-1998, with particular emphasis on election years. The majority of the videos in this series contain advertisements for individual candidates that were aired on television. Other videos contain compilations of advertisements produced by political advertising companies for promotional purposes; advertisements produced by political parties and interest groups; and advertisements for political services. Advertisements cover some local, as well as state and national elections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The videos of this series include local and network news reports, political talk shows, television newsmagazines, special reports, interviews and other broadcast programming. They range in date from 1984-2005 with some undated videos. The bulk of the series covers 1988-2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The videos of this series include educational programming on the political process, panel discussions and lectures on political topics, recordings of political seminars and institutes, documentaries produced by interest groups, focus groups and viewer call-in shows. They range in date from 1987-2000 with some undated videos. The bulk of the series covers 1987-1995. Most of the programming relates to the political process, the profession of politics or specific political issues. Seminar and institute recordings include the American University Campaign Institute, New York State Library Seminar Series, North Carolina Institute of Political Leadership, Campaign Management Institute, Columbia University Seminars on Media and Society and Graduate School of Political Management classes and forums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The videos of this series include campaign and political speeches, candidate debates, political party conventions and awards ceremonies. They range in date from 1980-2000 with some undated videos. The bulk of the series covers 1984-1996. The majority of these videos focus on national politics, including presidential elections.

did.unittitle: Nixon Speeches, "Republican Leadership at the Grassroots," RNC 1980 Spots

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Note: This video also contains Republican National Committee advertisements.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Note: These speeches and debates are on the video tape in box 1 tape number 4. It contains advertisements for Lew Lehrman, Mario Cuomo's State of the State address and a debate between Lehrman and Cuomo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The videos of this series include movies and documentaries on political topics. They range in date from 1986-1996 with several undated videos. The bulk of the series were produced from 1989-1992. Most of the movies are about presidents and the political process.

did.unittitle: :30 Second Democracy: A Documentary on Political Television Advertising

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Note: This movie is on the video in box 12 tape number 13. It contains a 1991 gubernatorial debate and movie about Franklin Delano Roosevelt.

did.unittitle: "Abortion: The New Civil War" and "The Final Days"

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Note: This movie is on the video in box 9 tape number 13. It contains a Fox news panal on abortion and a movie about Nixon's final days as president.
